me.donkeycore.minigamemanager.api.minigame

Class Minigame

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.donkeycore.minigamemanager.api.minigame.Minigame
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OneInTheQuiver, Spleef

    public abstract class Minigame
extends java.lang.Object
    The main minigame API class; all minigames should extend this class
    Author:
    DonkeyCore

      Listens to events sent by MinigameListener
      static interface  Minigame.Function<T,R>
      Represents a function; very useful for Java 8 plugins
      static class  Minigame.ImmutableTuple<L,R>
      Tuple that cannot be changed
      static interface  Minigame.ItemStackSupplier
      Supplies an itemstack and a slot to place the itemstack for every player given
      static interface  Minigame.LocationSupplier
      Supplies a location for every player given
      static class  Minigame.MutableTuple<L,R>
      Tuple that can be changed
      static interface  Minigame.PlayerConsumer
      Performs some operation for every player given
      static class  Minigame.Tuple<L,R>

      Set the scoreboard for all the players.

      • onStart

        public abstract void onStart()
        Called when the minigame starts and all players have been teleported to their starting locations. This is called after all players are teleported to their spawns

      • onEnd

        public void onEnd(int error)
        Called when the minigame ends
        Parameters:
        error - The error code (0 = no error)

      • end

        public void end(int error,
                WinnerList winners)
        Call this to end the minigame and continue to the next rotation
        Note: If this method is being overriden, make sure there is a call to Rotation.finish(int, WinnerList) or a call to 
         super.end()
        Parameters:
        error - The error code (0 = no error)
        winners - The winners of the minigame

      • end

        public final void end(WinnerList winners)
        End the minigame with nothing wrong. Equivalent to end(0)
        Parameters:
        winners - The winners of the minigame

        public final MinigameAttributes getAttributes()
        Get the attributes belonging to this minigame
        Returns:
        An instance of MinigameAttributes, or null if the annotation is not present (bad!)

      • giveAll

        public void giveAll(Minigame.ItemStackSupplier supplier)
        Give all the players an item. Equivalent to 
         giveAll(func, null);
        Parameters:
        supplier - An Minigame.ItemStackSupplier that, when given a player, returns a pair of itemstack to give to that player and the slot (-1 for any available slot)
        See Also:
        giveAll(ItemStackSupplier, PlayerConsumer)

      • giveAll

        public void giveAll(Minigame.ItemStackSupplier supplier,
                    Minigame.PlayerConsumer backup)
        Give all the players an item
        Parameters:
        supplier - An Minigame.ItemStackSupplier that, when given a player, returns a pair of itemstack to give to that player and the slot (-1 for any available slot)
        backup - An instance of Minigame.PlayerConsumer that says what to do in case the player can't receive the item (null to just ignore)

      • giveAll

        public void giveAll(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itemstack,
                    int slot)
        Give all the players an item. Equivalent to 
         giveAll(itemstack, slot, null);
        Parameters:
        itemstack - An ItemStack to give to each player
        slot - The slot number to put the item in
        See Also:
        giveAll(ItemStackSupplier, PlayerConsumer)

      • giveAll

        public void giveAll(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itemstack,
                    int slot,
                    Minigame.PlayerConsumer backup)
        Give all the players an item
        Parameters:
        itemstack - An ItemStack to give to each player
        slot - The slot number to put the item in
        backup - An instance of Minigame.PlayerConsumer that says what to do in case the player can't receive the item (null to just ignore)

      • generateRandomTeams

        public Team[] generateRandomTeams(int amount)
        Generate up to a specified amount of teams from the players in the rotation
        Parameters:
        amount - The maximum and ideal number of teams
        Returns:
        An array of Team objects generated with random colors and names that represent the color

      • setScoreboard

        public void setScoreboard(org.bukkit.scoreboard.Scoreboard scoreboard)
        Set the scoreboard for all the players.
        Equivalent to a PlayerConsumer iterating through all players and setting their scoreboards.
        To do this for a single player, just use player.setScoreboard(scoreboard);
        Parameters:
        scoreboard - The scoreboard to set for all players

      • setScoreboard

        public void setScoreboard(Minigame.Function<org.bukkit.entity.Player,org.bukkit.scoreboard.Scoreboard> scoreboards)
        Set scoreboards that can change per player
        Parameters:
        scoreboards - The function to supply scoreboards

        subtitle - The subtitle to send
        fadeIn - The amount of time in ticks it takes to fade in
